text: Smooth and tasty tofu wrapped in fragrant lemongrass bouquet,
yummy vegan patties of fried green rice that are crispy from the outside and glutinous from the inside,
or the rich and creamy coconut tapioca pudding are very familiar dishes with Vietnamese people.
But today I will prepare these dishes with secret ingredients
with special nutrition which will make these familiar dishes
much more fragrant and delicious with a unique taste of novelty.
Discover what those secret ingredients are in this video with me!
Hello, it’s Helen here.
Today I will cook a vegan meal with familiar delicacies for Vietnamese people,
yet using ingredients that  are new to  the Vietnamese.
These are the products of dry beans imported directly from the US.
which are chickpeas and red lentils.
These are non-GMO products with pure natural cultivation technology,
in which they do not use plant preservatives, chemical fertilizers
and other growth stimulating methods.
These dried beans are rich in nutrition
and good to eat for vegans, diet and postpartum women as well.
Chickpeas are used as raw material for many dishes like soups,
salads, braised dishes, bean curd and many other dishes.
Red lentils can be used for soup, sticky rice, porridge, sweet soups or stews
because the beans are easily mashed when cooked,
which is quite similar to Vietnamese mung beans.
Please notice that when cooking these beans, we should not add salt or vinegar to the cooking water,
because this will lengthen the cooking time.
Chickpeas must be soaked first, therefore they will be cooked faster.
Cooking instructions are noted very carefully on the package
so please  read through before using.
I will first make the FRIED CHICKPEA TOFU IN LEMONGRASS
Ingredients include:
200g dried chickpeas,
½ cup of flour,
1 bunch of lemongrass,
some cilantro and hot chili pepper.
Wash the dried chickpeas and soak overnight for about 8 hours to soften,
the water should be 3 times of the chickpeas.
After soaking, you will get about 400g of chickpeas,
transfer into a blender, puree with 500ml water.
Blend really well
to make the mixture is completely smooth.
Pour the chickpea mixture through a cloth bag,
then squeeze the water out.
Save the residue of the chickpeas for the next dish.
Pour the mixture into a pot
then bring to boil over medium heat to avoid burning, stir constantly
after 5 minutes the mixture will thicken as congee.
Give it a taste test, if it doesn’t smell like raw beans anymore then turn off the heat.
Pour the mixture into the mold. Let it cool and put it in the refrigerator.
So the homemade chickpea tofu is done.
Smell so good!
you can use this chickpea tofu in fried foods or soups like normal tofu,
but tofu made from chick peas has a rich and tasteful flavor
and more nutritious.
Cut off the white part of lemongrass and save for another dish,
then use the pestle to crush the green part
and tear into thin threads like straws.
Coat the lemongrass straws with flour and deep fry till golden brown.
I will tie a few lemongrass straws into bundles for decoration.
These are also coated with flour and deep fried.
Remove and drain the oil.
If we use this oil to fry the chickpea tofu, the tofu will be very lemongrass scented.
Cut the chicken tofu into squares of 0.5 cm thickness
Put a little of the lemongrass frying oil in a pan
and then drop the chickpea tofu and pan sear the tofu until golden brown on both sides.
Remember to fry the chickpea tofu with just a little oil, because frying with too much oil will break the tofu easily.
Using the lemongrass frying oil makes the tofu much more fragrant.
Remove and place on kitchen towel to absorb oil.
Place the shredded lemongrass underneath then place the tofu on top,
add bundles of lemongrasses.
Sprinkle with a some chopped cilantro and sliced chili for a pop of colors.
Serve with soy sauce with a little chili sauce.
How delicious!
Next follow the VEGETARIAN GREEN RICE PATTIES,
ingredients include
100g dried chickpeas ,
50g dried red lentils ,
60g flat green rice ,
pepper, stock powder,
cilantro, 1 piece of leek , chili ,
and some coconut stripes.
Soak 100g chickpeas for 8-12h until soft.
You can either peel the chickpeas or not.
If you want to peel, I will show you 1 kitchen hack on how to peel the chickpea quickly.
It’s adding a little baking soda into the soaked chickpeas
and putting into microwave for 1-2 minutes,
then pouring some water in and just squeezing lightly.
The shell of the chickpea will come off very easily.
Soak the red lentils for 30 minutes.
Thinly slice the leek then sautee till fragrant.
Fresh green sticky rice is only available in autumn but dried flat green sticky rice is sold in supermarkets all year round,
Get half of green rice (about 30g)
mix with 2tbsp of water or milk until soft.
Transfer both the soaked beans in a blender with chopped cilantro,
fried leek
with 1/3 tsp ground pepper and 1tsp stock powder.
Pulse to process finely.
Pour the ground mixture into a bowl and mix with green rice,
add a little coconut strips and mix well to combine
Apply your hands with some cooking oil and make a round flat-shaped patties .
Then roll the patties into the rest of the green rice in the plate,
press the patties to stick the green rice.
Heat oil in a saucepan until there are bubbles around the chopstick,
drop the patties and fry them on both sides until golden brown.
The dried green rice outside will puff up and turn into crunchy  beautiful crispies.
Remove and place on kitchen towel to drain off the oil.
Place all the patties on a plate, serve with soy sauce & chili sauce.
Absolutely delicious!
Let’s finish the meal with a sweet dish which is LENTIL TAPIOCA PEARLS IN COCONUT MILK!
Ingredients include : 200g US lentils,
80g tapioca starch,
400ml Coconut milk,
200g Sugar,
5 Pandan leaves,
tangerine peel,
and some coconut stripes.
Lentils contains many nutrients, fiber and low carbohydrates,
which is good for the digestive system and helps reduce cholesterol, prevents heart disease and stroke.
Wash 200g dried red lentilsuntil clean and place in pot with 1 liter of water.
Bring to a boil.
Wash 80g of tapioca pearls and then put in another pot
with 0.5 liter of water and bring to a boil.
Turn off heat and cover for 20 minutes.
After 15 minutes when the lentils turn soft, remove the foam,
add 200g of sugar , 400ml of coconut milk,
also remove the tapioca pearls and put it in that pot.
Drop in a bundle of pandan leaves
and finely chopped tangerine peel.
Tangerine peel will help with a very fragrant special taste.
This is my secret! You should try too.
Bring to the boil again and then turn off the heat.
Let cool and put in refrigerate so the sweet soup will thicken, serve with coconut strips.
Undeniably delicious!!!
The rich taste of US lentils blends with the creamy coconut milk
and the aroma of pandan leaves and tangerine peel,
which makes a simple yet unforgettable taste of this sweet soup!
Try it out and don't forget to send me picture of your results!
Goodbye and see you again. Bye ~
